snippet: Umberto Bossi — who founded the conservative, anti-immigrant Northern League — was famous for his cigars, white tank-tops and salty language.
abstract: Umberto Bossi, leader of Italy's conservative, anti-immigrant Northern League party and former backer of Silvio Berlusconi, quits amid a widening scandal of illegal party financing; resignation marks the end of the Berlusconi era and offers further sign of the political uncertainty in the country.
lead_paragraph: Umberto Bossi — who founded the conservative, anti-immigrant Northern League — was famous for his cigars, white tank-tops and salty language.

headline.seo: Bossi Quits as Head of Italy’s Northern League
headline.main: Italian Populist Party Leader Who Once Backed Berlusconi Quits, Ending an Era
headline.print_headline: Italian Populist Party Leader Who Once Backed Berlusconi Quits, Ending an Era
